title: Gurner adds $1.75billion Dockland precinct to his portfolio.
excerpt: Tim Gurner has added another jewel to his crown, joining forces with the Liberman family to develop a 1.8-hectare site at the Docklands.
imageAlt: Tim Gurner has added another jewel to his crown, joining forces with the Liberman family to develop a 1.8-hectare site at the Docklands.
author: Building Environs

sections.alt: Tim Gurner has added another jewel to his crown, joining forces with the Liberman family to develop a 1.8-hectare site at the Docklands.
sections.caption: Tim Gurner. Image credit: Gurner Group

sections.content: Tim Gurner has added another jewel to his crown, joining forces with the Liberman family to develop a 1.8-hectare site at the Docklands.
The world-class precinct, heralded as a destination venue, will feature:

The site is located at 208-226 Harbour Esplanade, opposite Marvel Stadium, and will be delivered in partnership with DHH consortium â€“ led by Liberman's, Qualitas Group, and other Melbourne families.

The development caps off a string of wins for Gurner, who recently opened offices in Sydney and Queensland as part of a 10-year strategic plan to diversify the business. The company has also expanded into South Australia, with plans to develop a 14,000 square metre site in the Adelaide CBD as part of a $1.25 billion mixed-use precinct project.
[Head to our podcast page](https://www.buildingenvirons.com.au/podcasts/) and listen to industry leaders talk shop with our Director, Martin Preece.
